result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J. Chapman

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM Defendant Eric J. Chapman in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Eric J. Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay and Atty Boese in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter set for trial. 
Atty Klein states she is not prepared for trial and does request an adjournment and states further reasons on the record. 
Atty Klein has received an offer in this matter and is not accepting of offer.  
State has no position. 
Atty Boese states there may be some negations in this matter.
Court will change trial date to 12/6/22
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on December 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:37 AM Defendant Eric J. Chapman in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Klein has received an offer in this matter and does request one last status in this matter. 
State does not object.
Matter to tag along with 21CF1572. 
All parties agree this matter is to tag along with Judge Bugenhagen Matters.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Jeremy Perri.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:55 AM Defendant Eric J. Chapman in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Defense requests this matter tag along with the other matters currently scheduled in Branch 10 in hopes of a global resolution.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Arraignment on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:39 AM  Defendant Eric J. Chapman by phone with attorney Jessica A Klein as a Friend of the Court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Klein is appointed to the defendant's other matters and expects to be appointed to this one as well.  The other matters are set before Judge Bugenhagen.
Defendant updates phone number.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

01:03 PM Defendant Eric J. Chapman in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
The States states that the information is not signed at this time and requests an arraignment.
The Court will set an arraignment within the 30 day time frame.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:32 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   Defendant Eric J. Chapman did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein states she just spoke to her client who indicated he thought the hearing was set for 10:45 am and is on his way.  Attorney Klein further states this matter will be a waiver of preliminary hearing.  The Court will adjourn the hearing to lockups this afternoon and orders the defendant appear in person at 1:00 pm.  The Court notes there was an officer witness present in Court today.  Time limits previously waived.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:46 PM Defendant Eric J. Chapman not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests prelim to be rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing to remain in place as previously scheduled.  Court finds Attorney and defendant have been made aware of the preliminary hearing.
From Washington Co Jail
